page.title: 17CONSERVATION
page.content:
{VICAR POND} {by SARAH McKIE
Vicar Spring has been called that since 1830. Vicar Water originally comes from Vicar Spring. Vicar Water is a dammed stream. Vicar Stream has been dammed and it is now a pond. Some recreation began in 1979 and was finished in 1984. Some of the trees have been planted and some of them are wild. Some of the birds that nest in Vicar Pond are ducks, heron and coot. Some of the fish in Vicar Pond are bream, carp and stickle backs. Eventually it will be a park for picnics and for day trips with picnic areas. The ranger Peter Jarman looks after the park and takes people round like schools and old age pensioners. Most of the pit tips have been reclaimed and grassed over. In twenty years it should be at its best.
